intro: Nasturtium microtites, commonly known as the dwarf nasturtium, is a compact flowering plant belonging to the Tropaeolaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and bright, spurred orange or yellow flowers that bloom throughout the summer. The plant is native to South America and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Its flowers are edible and often used in salads or as a garnish, while the leaves can be consumed raw or cooked. Nasturtium microtites is also valued for its ability to attract beneficial insects and its ornamental appeal in garden settings.
